comments.body:
The following code compiles previously:

```Scala
class Test:
   if
     5 < 6
   + 3
   then
    println("hello")
```

But I guess it's fine to reject it after the change.
I think it's OK, in particular since there is no legacy code, since leading infix operators are a Scala 3 thing.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +125,129 @@else d
```
is parsed as `if x then a + b + c else d`.

### Optional Braces Around Template Bodies

comments.body:
Maybe I am missing something, but I cannot recognize the `colonEol` in the parser code for packages:

https://github.com/lampepfl/dotty/blob/44514a34943134f7072881c63502d3f773204f1b/compiler/src/dotty/tools/dotc/parsing/Parsers.scala#L3720-L3724

Is `rewriteWithColon` doing this?

The comment above also does not reflect the colon: 

https://github.com/lampepfl/dotty/blob/44514a34943134f7072881c63502d3f773204f1b/compiler/src/dotty/tools/dotc/parsing/Parsers.scala#L3718
It's in `possibleTemplateStart()`. I added a test to verify that `:` is indeed significant.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +144,148 @@Template    ::=  InheritClauses [colonEol] [TemplateBody]
EnumDef     ::=  id ClassConstr InheritClauses [colonEol] EnumBody
Packaging   ::=  ‘package’ QualId [nl | colonEol] ‘{’ TopStatSeq ‘}’
SimpleExpr  ::=  ‘new’ ConstrApp {‘with’ ConstrApp} [[colonEol] TemplateBody]
```

comments.body: The `try` seems to be a display problem, it looks fine when we render the page separately.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +278,282 @@```
EndMarker         ::=  ‘end’ EndMarkerTag    -- when followed by EOL
EndMarkerTag      ::=  id | ‘if’ | ‘while’ | ‘for’ | ‘match’ | ‘try’
                    |  ‘new’ | ‘this’ | ‘given’ | ‘extension’ | ‘val’
BlockStat         ::=  ... | EndMarker
